item.title: Add a Developer Console to your C++ Game in 22 Lines of Code
item.description: Many computer games have a developer console or in-game console which provide a command-line interface for executing commands, changing game variables, or activating cheats. It’s a very useful feature seen in many games like Quake, Skyrim, Minecraft, and Counter-Strike. The following is an in-game console present in every Source game: In this guide, I will explain how to add a complete developer console to your C++ game in 22 lines of code.

item.title: How to switch Windows App to Console App
item.description: When making a C++ executable on Windows, you have the option of choosing between a Windows app and a Console app. A Windows app is an app with a GUI Window, and a Console app runs in the terminal (e.g. Windows Command Prompt). By switching over a Windows App to a Console App, you will get a command prompt window accompanying your GUI program Window. Linker Option Visual Studio or MSVC C++ Compiler Set the /SUBSYSTEM linker option of the MSVC compiler for your project to CONSOLE.

item.title: John Carmack UMKC Commencement Speech
item.description: “There are lots of viable paths through engineering. The path I advocate for is ‘knowledge in depth’ - for knowing things really deeply. It’s true that the modern wizardry of building amazing applications by bashing together a bunch of JavaScript libraries and web services has indeed minted a lot of startup millionaires, but it does remind me of Mickey Mouse as the sorcerer’s apprentice in Fantasia animating broomsticks with magic he doesn’t really understand and eventually making a really big mess.
